snippet: The proposal to hold talks in Geneva at a point when the Syrian opposition has suffered a bitter reversal has led many in the opposition to question the West’s strategy.
abstract: Syrian opposition leader Gen Salim Idris says opposition will not attend proposed conference in Geneva unless rebels receive new supplies of arms and ammunition; says Pres Bashar al-Assad's military position has been strengthened by arms shipments from Iran and thousands of fighters from Hezbollah.

byline.contributor: Hala Droubi contributed reporting from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

lead_paragraph: The proposal to hold talks in Geneva at a point when the Syrian opposition has suffered a bitter reversal has led many in the opposition to question the West’s strategy.

headline.seo: Syria Opposition Won’t Attend Talks Unless Rebels Get Arms, Commander Says
headline.main: Syrian Opposition to Sit Out Any Talks Unless Arms Are Sent, General Says
headline.print_headline: Syrian Opposition to Sit Out Any Talks Unless Arms Are Sent, General Says

keywords.value: National Coalition of Syrian Revolutionary and Opposition Forces
keywords.name: organizations
